parameters: \n<Coroner>Get serious, detective, I'm not talking to a dog!
\n<Coroner>Good evening, detective. I'm the coroner. How can I help with your investigation?
\n<Coroner>You'll find the victim's body along the castle wall to the west. Everything is left untouched.
\n<Coroner>Once you've assessed the body you'll be free to explore the castle.
\n<Coroner>That gargoyle fell off the roof and struck his head! I've never seen anything like it. A touch of the dramatic, for sure.
\n<Coroner>The force of the blow must have killed him instantly. No doubt about that, but take a look for yourself.
\n<Coroner>Mr. Gallant died between 7 and 8 pm last night. That's just about 24 hours ago.
\n<Coroner>That gargoyle is quite heavy. It would take more than a gust of wind to make it fall over. I don't have an explanation.
It looks like an old library book somebody left here. The book title is "Historic Castle Ludwig".
"Castle Ludwig was built in 1900 by wealthy quarry owner Herr Wilhelm Ludwig, though he died shortly after finishing construction of the castle."
"A myriad of strange events have led many people to believe that Castle Ludwig is haunted. This book explores the castle's incredible history."
The clue is saved to your Casefile. Cleo deserves a treat.
The dead body of the famous, eccentric video game designer, "Lord" Russell Gallant.
It obviously happened just as the coroner said.
I wonder what the coroner says about this.
But to be crushed by a gargoyle outside a supposedly haunted castle? That seems at least a little bit suspicious...
The dead body of the famous, eccentric video game designer, "Lord" Russell Gallant.
It obviously happened just as the coroner said.
I wonder what the coroner says about this.
But to be crushed by a gargoyle outside a supposedly haunted castle? That seems at least a little bit suspicious...
Wait, Detective. Did you learn about the original castle builder's occupation?
I hope that was an easy one.
Go to the Mountain Road map?
When you've got enough evidence that you think you're ready to make an arrest, come back here and find me.
That explanation is not consistent with the facts. Maybe you should investigate further.
\n<Officer Adams> Wait, Detective. Did you learn how Russell Gallant was killed?
\n<Officer Adams>When you've got enough evidence that you think you're ready to make an arrest, come back here and find me.
\n<Officer Adams>That explanation is not consistent with the facts. Maybe you should investigate further.
\n<Officer Bailey>Right, like I'm gonna talk to the dog. Ha. Ha. Ha.
\n<Officer Bailey>Us local police have been all over Russell Gallant's estate already, but we haven't found any clues.
\n<Officer Bailey>However, your clue-sniffing dog might be able to find something we missed. You should explore with Cleo as the party leader.
\n<Officer Bailey>This way you'll see "?" question marks appearing on the map. Go interact with one and you'll discover a clue!
\n<Officer Bailey>Clues won't appear if Guy is the party leader though. So make sure you take advantage of Cleo's fantastic detection skills.
\n<Officer Adams>Well hello there! You must be Cleo, the remarkable clue-sniffing dog we've heard so much about! Aww!!
\n<Officer Adams>Hello and welcome, Detective Guy. So glad you made it. This one is truly a baffling case, and we need your help!
\n<Officer Adams>I'll fill you in on the basics. What do you want to know first?
\n<Officer Adams>Don't worry, I'm here to help you get your bearings.
\n<Officer Adams>Use the arrow keys to move. Holding down the Shift key will make you move faster.
\n<Officer Adams>To talk to someone, press Enter or Space bar. Space bar or Enter will select a dialog option.
\n<Officer Adams>Press Escape to access the menu and see the Casefile, then press escape again to close the menu.
\n<Officer Adams>If you need a hint about what to do next, you can access the "hint" function via the menu.
\n<Officer Adams>An illustrated map of the castle and surrounding area can be found in the menu too.
\n<Officer Adams>Lastly, you can use the menu to save your game.
\n<Officer Adams>Very well, let's get right to it.
\n<Officer Adams>You're a man in need of no introduction around here, Detective Guy. You've already helped solve some tough ones.
\n<Officer Adams>But even more famous is Cleo, your partner in crime-solving. She's a clue-sniffing dog. Cleo can find clues we humans can't.
\n<Officer Adams>You and Cleo make quite the team. Press "S" to toggle between Guy or Cleo as the leader.
\n<Officer Adams>Castle Ludwig, here in rural Vermont, was a tourist attraction before the victim bought the place. It's a real castle!
\n<Officer Adams>I'm no expert, but there have long been rumors about the castle. Evil spirits. Strange stuff... Have fun with that.
\n<Officer Adams>The victim is "Lord" Russell Gallant, the owner of Castle Ludwig.  It was big news when he bought this place. Heard of him?
\n<Officer Adams>Even people who dont play video games know about Paladin Dream. Russell Gallant designed the game.
\n<Officer Adams>Lord Gallant's successful game made him a very wealthy man. Well, now he's dead.
\n<Officer Adams>The coroner is by the entrance to Castle Ludwig. She can tell you more about the cause of death based on her expertise.
\n<Officer Adams>It seems the victim had some kind of business meeting here last night. A publishing executive and a coworker came to negotiate.
\n<Officer Adams>Also inside the castle are the victim's wife, and adopted daughter. Plus the groundskeeper. You should interview them all.
\n<Officer Adams>A small number of other people were nearby too. You'll meet them via the mountain road. There are 8 suspects.
\n<Officer Adams>We're counting on you, Detective Guy. And you too, Cleo. Good luck!
\n<Officer Adams>You're a man in need of no introduction around here, Detective Guy. You've already helped solve some tough ones.
\n<Officer Adams>But even more famous is Cleo, your partner in crime-solvng. She's a clue-sniffing dog. Cleo can find clues we humans can't.
\n<Officer Adams>You and Cleo make quite the team. Press "S" to toggle between Guy or Cleo as the leader.

\n<Officer Adams>The victim is "Lord" Russell Gallant, the owner of Castle Ludwig. It was big news when he bought this place. Heard of him?
\n<Officer Adams>Even people who dont play video games know about Paladin Dream. Russell Gallant designed the game.
\n<Officer Adams>Lord Gallant's successful game made him a very wealthy man. Well, now he's dead.
\n<Officer Adams>The coroner is by the entrance to Castle Ludwig. She can tell you more about the cause of death based on her expertise.
\n<Officer Adams>I'm no expert, but there have long been rumors about the castle. Evil spirits. Strange stuff... Have fun with that.
\n<Officer Adams>It seems the victim had some kind of business meeting here last night. A publishing executive and a coworker came to negotiate.
\n<Officer Adams>Also inside the castle are the victim's wife, and adopted daughter. Plus the groundskeeper. You should interview them all.
\n<Officer Adams>A small number of other people were nearby too. You'll meet them via the mountain road. There are 8 suspects.
\n<Officer Adams>We're counting on you, Detective Guy. And you too, Cleo. Good luck!
This wall has many windows from which people inside the castle can see outside.
However, the wall by where the victim was killed had no windows. That's unusual.
The clue is saved to your Casefile. Cleo deserves a treat.
\n<Coroner> Get serious, detective, I'm not talking to a dog!
\n<Coroner>Good evening, detective. I'm the coroner. How can I help with your investigation?
\n<Coroner>You'll find the victim's body along the castle wall to the west. Everything is left untouched.
\n<Coroner>Once you've assessed the body you'll be free to explore the castle.
\n<Coroner>That gargoyle fell off the roof and struck his head! I've never seen anything like it. A touch of the dramatic, for sure.
\n<Coroner>The force of the blow must have killed him instantly. No doubt about that, but take a look for yourself.
\n<Coroner>Mr. Gallant died between 7 and 8 pm last night. That's just about 24 hours ago.
\n<Coroner>That gargoyle is quite heavy. It would take more than a gust of wind to make it fall over. I don't have an explanation.
\n<Fireman>Cute dog, but I'm not in the mood to play. This is a crime scene, after all.
\n<Fireman>Is it true that someone saw the gargoyle move, like it was alive? You probably aren't allowed to tell me. Never mind.
\n<Fireman>Anyway, access to the mountain road is all yours now. Have at it, detective.
\n<Fireman>Cute dog, but I'm not in the mood to play. This is a crime scene, after all.
\n<Fireman>My team has secured the area for you to do your job. No one comes in, no one goes out. This way everything is left untouched.
\n<Fireman>You should look for clues. Once you find something important, I'll move out so you can explore the mountain road.
Congratulations, you completed the demo for "Murder Is Game Over"!
Please consider purchasing the full game if you enjoyed the demo.
